Basic.name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
Basic.flavor: Oozes love Flamenco.  Don't ask.

Basic.name: Arcane Explosion
Basic.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions.
Basic.flavor: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.

Basic.name: Bloodfen Raptor
Basic.flavor: "Kill 30 raptors." - Hemet Nesingwary

Basic.name: Bluegill Warrior
Basic.flavor: He just wants a hug.   A sloppy... slimy... hug.

Basic.name: Cleave
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage to two random enemy minions.
Basic.flavor: Hey you two…could you stand next to each other for a second…

Basic.name: Divine Spirit
Basic.flavor: Double the trouble. Double the fun!

Basic.name: Fiery War Axe
Basic.flavor: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.

Basic.name: Flametongue Totem
Basic.flavor: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.

Basic.name: Frostbolt
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage to a character and Freeze it.
Basic.flavor: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.

Basic.name: Frostwolf Grunt
Basic.flavor: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that.   It's more than just a job.

Basic.name: Heroic Strike
Basic.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn.
Basic.flavor: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.

Basic.name: Holy Light
Basic.flavor: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.

Basic.name: Kobold Geomancer
Basic.flavor: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...

Basic.name: Life Tap
Basic.text: Hero Power Draw a card and take $2 damage.

Basic.name: Mark of the Wild
Basic.text: Give a minion Taunt and +2/+2. (+2 Attack/+2 Health)
Basic.flavor: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.

Basic.name: Mind Blast
Basic.text: Deal $5 damage to the enemy hero.
Basic.flavor: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.

Basic.name: Murloc Tidehunter
Basic.flavor: "Death will rise, from the tides!"

Basic.name: NOOOOOOOOOOOO
Basic.text: Somehow, the card you USED to have has been deleted.  Here, have this one instead!
Basic.flavor: Even your flavor text has been deleted. Dang.

Basic.name: Novice Engineer
Basic.flavor: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

Basic.name: Reinforce
Basic.text: Hero Power Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Recruit.

Basic.name: River Crocolisk
Basic.flavor: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.

Basic.name: Sap
Basic.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.
Basic.flavor: Rogues love sappy movies.

Basic.name: Shadow Word: Pain
Basic.text: Destroy a minion with 3 or less Attack.
Basic.flavor: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

Basic.name: Shiv
Basic.flavor: Rogues are experts at SHIV-al-ry.

Basic.name: Steady Shot
Basic.text: Hero Power Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero.

Basic.name: Succubus
Basic.flavor: Warlocks have it pretty good.

Basic.name: Wild Growth
Basic.flavor: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

Basic.name: Windfury
Basic.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

Classic.name: Amani Berserker
Classic.text: Enrage: +3 Attack
Classic.flavor: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".

Classic.name: Ancestral Spirit
Classic.text: Give a minion "Deathrattle: Resummon this minion."
Classic.flavor: It was just a flesh wound.

Classic.name: Ancient Watcher
Classic.text: Can't attack.
Classic.flavor: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?

Classic.name: Argent Protector
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Divine Shield.
Classic.flavor: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."

Classic.name: Armorsmith
Classic.text: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.
Classic.flavor: She accepts guild funds for repairs!

Classic.name: Battle Rage
Classic.text: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.
Classic.flavor: "You won't like me when I'm angry."

Classic.name: Betrayal
Classic.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.
Classic.flavor: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.

Classic.name: Bloodmage Thalnos
Classic.text: Spell Damage +1. Deathrattle: Draw a card.
Classic.flavor: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!

Classic.name: Bloodsail Raider
Classic.text: Battlecry: Gain Attack equal to the Attack of your weapon.
Classic.flavor: "I only plunder on days that end in 'y'."

Classic.name: Commanding Shout
Classic.text: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card.
Classic.flavor: "Shout! Shout! Let it all out!" - Advice to warriors-in-training

Classic.name: Crazed Alchemist
Classic.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
Classic.flavor: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.

Classic.name: Cruel Taskmaster
Classic.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
Classic.flavor: "I'm going to need you to come in on Sunday." - Cruel Taskmaster

Classic.name: Defias Ringleader
Classic.text: Combo: Summon a 2/1 Defias Bandit.
Classic.flavor: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.

Classic.name: Demonfire
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it’s a friendly Demon, give it +2/+2 instead.
Classic.flavor: Demonfire is like regular fire except for IT NEVER STOPS BURNING HELLLPPP

Classic.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
Classic.text: Adjacent minions have +1 Attack.
Classic.flavor: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.

Classic.name: Doomsayer
Classic.text: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions.
Classic.flavor: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.

Classic.name: Equality
Classic.text: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
Classic.flavor: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.

Classic.name: Eviscerate
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage. Combo: Deal $4 damage instead.
Classic.flavor: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent:  It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.

Classic.name: Explosive Trap
Classic.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, deal $2 damage to all enemies.
Classic.flavor: It traps your food AND cooks it for you!

Classic.name: Faerie Dragon
Classic.text: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
Classic.flavor: Adorable.  Immune to Magic.  Doesn't pee on the rug.  The perfect pet!

Classic.name: Flare
Classic.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
Classic.flavor: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!

Classic.name: Freezing Trap
Classic.text: Secret: When an enemy minion attacks, return it to its owner's hand and it costs (2) more.
Classic.flavor: "Dang, that's cold." - appropriate response to Freezing Trap, or a mean joke.

Classic.name: Gnoll
Classic.text: Taunt

Classic.name: INFERNO!
Classic.text: Hero Power Summon a 6/6 Infernal.

Classic.name: Knife Juggler
Classic.text: After you summon a minion, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
Classic.flavor: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers.    They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.

Classic.name: Lightwell
Classic.text: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
Classic.flavor: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.

Classic.name: Loot Hoarder
Classic.text: Deathrattle: Draw a card.
Classic.flavor: Always roll need.

Classic.name: Lorewalker Cho
Classic.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
Classic.flavor: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.

Classic.name: Mad Bomber
Classic.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.
Classic.flavor: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.

Classic.name: Mana Addict
Classic.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
Classic.flavor: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.

Classic.name: Mana Wraith
Classic.text: ALL minions cost (1) more.
Classic.flavor: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. "Mmmmmm," they say.

Classic.name: Master Swordsmith
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.
Classic.flavor: He's currently trying to craft a "flail-axe", but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.

Classic.name: Millhouse Manastorm
Classic.text: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (0) next turn.
Classic.flavor: "I'm gonna light you up, sweetcheeks!"

Classic.name: Mind Shatter
Classic.text: Hero Power Deal $3 damage.

Classic.name: Mind Spike
Classic.text: Hero Power Deal $2 damage.

Classic.name: Misdirection
Classic.text: Secret: When a character attacks your hero, instead he attacks another random character.
Classic.flavor: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.

Classic.name: Nat Pagle
Classic.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
Classic.flavor: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

Classic.name: Patient Assassin
Classic.text: Stealth. Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
Classic.flavor: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

Classic.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
Classic.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
Classic.flavor: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

Classic.name: Power of the Wild
Classic.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.
Classic.flavor: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.

Classic.name: Rampage
Classic.text: Give a damaged minion +3/+3.
Classic.flavor: Minion get ANGRY.   Minion SMASH!

Classic.name: Scavenging Hyena
Classic.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
Classic.flavor: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

Classic.name: Slam
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.
Classic.flavor: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.

Classic.name: Snake Trap
Classic.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
Classic.flavor: Why did it have to be snakes?

Classic.name: Snipe
Classic.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal $4 damage to it.
Classic.flavor: A great sniper hits the spot.  Just like a delicious flank of boar. Mmmmm.

Classic.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
Classic.text: Your spells cost (1) less.
Classic.flavor: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!"

Classic.name: Spirit Wolf
Classic.text: Taunt

Classic.name: Stormforged Axe
Classic.text: Overload: (1)
Classic.flavor: Yo, that's a nice axe.

Classic.name: Sunfury Protector
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt.
Classic.flavor: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

Classic.name: Treant
Classic.text: Taunt

Classic.name: Wild Pyromancer
Classic.text: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
Classic.flavor: BOOM BABY BOOM!  BAD IS GOOD!  DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

Classic.name: Wrath
Classic.text: Choose One - Deal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage and draw a card.
Classic.flavor: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.

Classic.name: Youthful Brewmaster
Classic.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
Classic.flavor: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

Classic.name: Ysera Awakens
Classic.text: Deal $5 damage to all characters except Ysera.

Reward.name: Captain's Parrot
Reward.text: Battlecry: Put a random Pirate from your deck into your hand.
Reward.flavor: Pirates and Parrots go together like Virmen and Carrots.
Reward.howToGet: Unlocked when you have all the Pirates from the Classic Set.
Reward.howToGetGold: Unlocked when you have all the Golden Pirates from the Expert Set.

Naxxramas.name: Decimate
Naxxramas.text: Hero Power Change the Health of all minions to 1.

Naxxramas.name: Echoing Ooze
Naxxramas.text: Battlecry: Summon an exact copy of this minion at the end of the turn.
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Frostwyrm Lair, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Naxxramas.name: Haunted Creeper
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Naxxramas.name: Mad Scientist
Naxxramas.text: Deathrattle: Put a Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
Naxxramas.flavor: His mother wanted him to be a mage or a warlock, but noooooooo, he had to go and be a scientist like his father.
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Construct Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Naxxramas.name: Mindpocalypse
Naxxramas.text: Both players draw 2 cards and gain a Mana Crystal.

Naxxramas.name: Necrotic Aura
Naxxramas.text: Hero Power Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero.

Naxxramas.name: Nerub'ar Weblord
Naxxramas.flavor: Weblords spend all day making giant trampoline parks.
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Naxxramas.name: Nerubian Egg
Naxxramas.flavor: Eggs are a good source of protein and Nerubians.
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Arachnid Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Naxxramas.name: Poison Cloud
Naxxramas.text: Hero Power Deal 1 damage to all minions. If any die, summon a slime.

Naxxramas.name: Rain of Fire
Naxxramas.text: Hero Power Fire a missile for each card in your opponent's hand.

Naxxramas.name: Reincarnate
Naxxramas.text: Destroy a minion, then return it to life with full Health.
Naxxramas.flavor: It's like birth, except you're an adult and you were just dead a second ago.
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Military Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Naxxramas.name: Unstable Ghoul
Naxxramas.flavor: Filling your Ghouls with Rocket Fuel is all the rage at Necromancer school.
Naxxramas.howToGet: Unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.
Naxxramas.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Plague Quarter, in the Naxxramas adventure.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Annoy-o-Tron
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Taunt Divine Shield
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The inventor of the Annoy-o-Tron was immediately expelled from Tinkerschool, Tinkertown, and was eventually exiled from the Eastern Kingdoms altogether.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Anodized Robo Cub
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Taunt. Choose One - +1 Attack; or +1 Health.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: It's adorable! AND OH MY GOODNESS WHY IS IT EATING MY FACE

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Call Pet
Goblins vs Gnomes.text:
Draw a card.
If it's a Beast, it costs (4) less.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Real hunters tame hungry crabs.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Crackle
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deal $3-$6 damage. Overload: (1)
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Snap! This card! Pop!

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Darkbomb
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deal $3 damage.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: If you're looking to make an "Emo" deck, this card is perfect!

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Explosive Sheep
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to all minions.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: How is this supposed to work? Your enemies think, "Hey! Cute sheep!" and run over to cuddle it?

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Feign Death
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Trigger all Deathrattles on your minions.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The hardest part about doing a "Feign Death" convincingly is learning how to make the right smell. It takes a lot of commitment.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Flamecannon
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deal $4 damage to a random enemy minion.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Calling something a flamecannon really doesn't do much to distinguish it from other goblin devices.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Gilblin Stalker
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Stealth
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor:
"Shhh, I think I hear something."

"Ah, it's probably nothing." - Every Henchman

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Glaivezooka
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion +1 Attack.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: For the times when a regular bazooka just isn't enough.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Goblin Auto-Barber
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1 Attack.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: This guy is excellent at adjusting your haircut and/or height.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Mechwarper
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Your Mechs cost (1) less.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Mechs that summon mechs? What's next? Donuts that summon donuts? Mmmmm.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Micro Machine
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: At the start of each turn, gain +1 Attack.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: This card is the real thing.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Mistress of Pain
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever this minion deals damage, restore that much Health to your hero.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Her sister is the Mistress of Pane who sells windows and shower doors.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: One-eyed Cheat
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever you summon a Pirate, gain Stealth.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: When pirates say there is no "Eye" in "team," they are very literal about it.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Puddlestomper
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Recombobulator
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random minion with the same Cost.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Seal of Light
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Restore #4 Health to your hero and gain +2 Attack this turn.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The walrus of Light restores EIGHT Health.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Shadowboxer
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever a character is healed, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Punching is its primary function. Also, its secondary function.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Shielded Minibot
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Divine Shield
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Ship's Cannon
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: After you summon a Pirate, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: If you hear someone yell, "Cannonball!" you're about to get wet. Or crushed.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Shrinkmeister
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give a minion -2 Attack this turn.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Snowchugger
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Do the slow chant when he waddles by: "Chug! Chug! Chug!"

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Steamwheedle Sniper
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Your Hero Power can target minions.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Goblins seldom have the patience for sniping. Most prefer lobbing explosives.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Stonesplinter Trogg
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +1 Attack.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The only thing worse than smelling troggs is listening to their poetry.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Unstable Portal
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The denizens of Azeroth have no idea how much work goes into stabilizing portals.  We spend like 30% of GDP on portal upkeep.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Vitality Totem
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: At the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: You can usually find these at the totemist's market on Saturdays.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Whirling Zap-o-matic
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Windfury
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: If you pay a little extra, you can get it in "candy-apple red."

Blackrock Mountain.name: Activate Arcanotron
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Activate Arcanotron!

Blackrock Mountain.name: Activate Toxitron
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Activate Toxitron!

Blackrock Mountain.name: Activate!
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Activate a random Tron.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Bone Minions
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Summon two 2/1 Bone Constructs.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Bone Minions
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Summon two 4/2 Bone Constructs.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Chromatic Dragonkin
Blackrock Mountain.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +2/+2.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Chromatic Mutation
Blackrock Mountain.text: Transform a minion into a 2/2 Chromatic Dragonkin.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Chromatic Prototype
Blackrock Mountain.text: Taunt

Blackrock Mountain.name: DIE, INSECT!
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Deal $8 damage to a random enemy.

Blackrock Mountain.name: DIE, INSECTS!
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Deal $8 damage to a random enemy. TWICE.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Gang Up
Blackrock Mountain.text: Choose a minion. Shuffle 3 copies of it into your deck.
Blackrock Mountain.flavor: If you are thinking about visiting Moonbrook, you better roll deep.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Lava Shock
Blackrock Mountain.text: Deal $2 damage. Unlock your Overloaded Mana Crystals.
Blackrock Mountain.flavor: Chocolate lava cake is shockingly delicious.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGet: Unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Molten Core, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

Blackrock Mountain.name: LAVA!
Blackrock Mountain.text: Deal $2 damage to all minions.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Moira Bronzebeard
Blackrock Mountain.text: Thaurissan's Hero Power can't be used. Never attacks minions unless they have Taunt.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Moira Bronzebeard
Blackrock Mountain.text: Thaurissan's Hero Power can't be used. Never attacks minions unless they have Taunt.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Old Horde
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Summon two 1/1 Orcs with Taunt. Get a new Hero Power.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Old Horde
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Summon two 2/2 Orcs with Taunt. Get a new Hero Power.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Open the Gates
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Summon three 1/1 Whelps. Get a new Hero Power.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Open the Gates
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Summon three 2/2 Whelps. Get a new Hero Power.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Power of the Firelord
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Deal 30 damage.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Quick Shot
Blackrock Mountain.text:
Deal $3 damage.
If your hand is empty, draw a card.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Release the Aberrations!
Blackrock Mountain.text: Summon 3 Aberrations.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Resurrect
Blackrock Mountain.text: Summon a random friendly minion that died this game.
Blackrock Mountain.flavor: I walked into the dungeon and noticed a slain adventurer. In his final moments, he had scrawled out a message in the dust on the wall beside him. Two words: "rez plz"
Blackrock Mountain.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackrock Depths, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

Blackrock Mountain.name: Revenge
Blackrock Mountain.text: Deal $1 damage to all minions. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $3 damage instead.
Blackrock Mountain.flavor: This is better than Arcane Explosion, so I guess warriors are finally getting revenge on mages for Mortal Strike being worse than Fireball.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGet: Unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.
Blackrock Mountain.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in Blackwing Lair, in the Blackrock Mountain adventure.

Blackrock Mountain.name: The Majordomo
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Summon a 1/3 Flamewaker Acolyte.

Blackrock Mountain.name: The Majordomo
Blackrock Mountain.text: Hero Power Summon a 3/3 Flamewaker Acolyte.

The Grand Tournament.name: Alexstrasza's Champion
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Charge.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: "Put more spikes on her.  No, more spikes.  What part of 'more spikes' do you not understand?  MORE SPIKES!" - Alexstrasza

The Grand Tournament.name: Ancestral Knowledge
The Grand Tournament.text: Draw 2 cards. Overload: (2).
The Grand Tournament.flavor: MOMMMMMYYYYYYYYY!!!

The Grand Tournament.name: Argent Lance
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, +1 Durability.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: The stripes make it look like a candy cane, but we recommend against licking it.

The Grand Tournament.name: Argent Watchman
The Grand Tournament.text: Can't attack. Inspire: Can attack as normal this turn.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Who argent watches the Argent Watchman?

The Grand Tournament.name: Ballista Shot
The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Deal $3 damage to the enemy hero.

The Grand Tournament.name: Bear Trap
The Grand Tournament.text: Secret: After your hero is attacked, summon a 3/3 Bear with Taunt.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: You'll never guess what's in that conveniently bear-sized, bear-smelling box.

The Grand Tournament.name: Bolster
The Grand Tournament.text: Give your Taunt minions +2/+2.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: The best offense is a good defense.

The Grand Tournament.name: Boneguard Lieutenant
The Grand Tournament.text: Inspire: Gain +1 Health.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Underneath all that impressive armor, he's just skin and bones.  Okay, maybe just bones.

The Grand Tournament.name: Confuse
The Grand Tournament.text: Swap the Attack and Health of all minions.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: This minion is really powerful!

The Grand Tournament.name: Convert
The Grand Tournament.text: Put a copy of an enemy minion into your hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: "Are you interested in... HEALTH benefits?!"

The Grand Tournament.name: Cutpurse
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever this minion attacks a hero, add the Coin to your hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: He has a giant collection of purses now.  One for every outfit!

The Grand Tournament.name: Darnassus Aspirant
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Gain an empty Mana Crystal. Deathrattle: Lose a Mana Crystal.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: She loves mana crystals, she hates mana crystals.   So fickle!

The Grand Tournament.name: Demonfuse
The Grand Tournament.text: Give a Demon +3/+3. Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Very dangerous when attached to a demonbomb.

The Grand Tournament.name: Dire Shapeshift
The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Gain 2 Armor and +2 Attack this turn.

The Grand Tournament.name: Druid of the Saber
The Grand Tournament.text: Choose One - Transform to gain Charge; or +1/+1 and Stealth.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: That's saberTEETH, not like curved pirate blades.  That's a different kind of druid.  Druid of the Curved Pirate Blades.

The Grand Tournament.name: Fallen Hero
The Grand Tournament.text: Your Hero Power deals 1 extra damage.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: And he can't get up.

The Grand Tournament.name: Fireblast Rank 2
The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Deal $2 damage.

The Grand Tournament.name: Flame Juggler
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: At first he liked juggling chain saws, but then he thought, "Flames are better!  Because FIRE!"

The Grand Tournament.name: Garrison Commander
The Grand Tournament.text: You can use your Hero Power twice a turn.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: He'll never admit it, but he pushes you hard because he really cares about you.

The Grand Tournament.name: Heal
The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Restore #4 Health.

The Grand Tournament.name: King's Elekk
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Elekk jousting is AWESOME.

The Grand Tournament.name: Lance Carrier
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Lance Carrier is an obscure entry level position in orcish armies.  A mystery, since orcs don't generally use lances.

The Grand Tournament.name: Lightning Jolt
The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Deal $2 damage.

The Grand Tournament.name: Lock and Load
The Grand Tournament.text: Each time you cast a spell this turn, add a random Hunter card to your hand.
The Grand Tournament.flavor:
Rexxar narrowed his eyes, grabbed his machine gun, and said: "It's go time.  Lock and load."

This card pays homage to that special moment.

The Grand Tournament.name: Poisoned Daggers
The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Equip a 2/2 Weapon.

The Grand Tournament.name: Sabertooth Lion
The Grand Tournament.text: Charge

The Grand Tournament.name: Sabertooth Panther
The Grand Tournament.text: Stealth

The Grand Tournament.name: Sabertooth Tiger
The Grand Tournament.text: Charge, Stealth

The Grand Tournament.name: Soul Tap
The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Draw a card.

The Grand Tournament.name: Sparring Partner
The Grand Tournament.text: Taunt Battlecry: Give a minion Taunt.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Come at me, bro.

The Grand Tournament.name: Tank Up!
The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Gain 4 Armor.

The Grand Tournament.name: The Silver Hand
The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Summon two 1/1 Recruits.

The Grand Tournament.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

The Grand Tournament.name: Totem Golem
The Grand Tournament.text: Overload: (1).
The Grand Tournament.flavor: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.

The Grand Tournament.name: Totemic Slam
The Grand Tournament.text: Hero Power Summon a Totem of your choice.

The Grand Tournament.name: Undercity Valiant
The Grand Tournament.text: Combo: Deal 1 damage.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

The Grand Tournament.name: Wrathguard
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.

The Grand Tournament.name: Wyrmrest Agent
The Grand Tournament.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!

The League of Explorers.name: Curse of Rafaam
The League of Explorers.text:
Give your opponent a 'Cursed!' card.
While they hold it, they take 2 damage on their turn.
The League of Explorers.flavor: This is what happens when Rafaam stubs his toe unexpectedly.
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Cursed!
The League of Explorers.text: While this is in your hand, take 2 damage at the start of your turn.

The League of Explorers.name: Dark Peddler
The League of Explorers.flavor: I'm offering you a bargain here!  This amazing vacuum cleaner for your soul!
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Dart Trap
The League of Explorers.text: Secret: After an opposing Hero Power is used, deal $5 damage to a random enemy.
The League of Explorers.flavor: Five years of tap-dancing lessons are FINALLY going to pay off!
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Enraged!
The League of Explorers.text: Give your hero +2 attack this turn.

The League of Explorers.name: Enraged!
The League of Explorers.text: Give your hero +5 attack this turn.

The League of Explorers.name: Explorer's Hat
The League of Explorers.text: Give a minion +1/+1 and "Deathrattle: Add an Explorer's Hat to your hand."
The League of Explorers.flavor: Harrison Jones was disappointed that he didn't get to be part of the League of Explorers, but his hat did.
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked by starting the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Can be crafted after starting the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Huge Toad
The League of Explorers.text: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in The Ruined City, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Jeweled Scarab
The League of Explorers.flavor: It's amazing what you can do with super glue!
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Temple of Orsis, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Map to the Golden Monkey
The League of Explorers.text: Shuffle the Golden Monkey into your deck. Draw a card.

The League of Explorers.name: Museum Curator
The League of Explorers.flavor: He is forever cursing the kids who climb on the rails and the evil archeologists who animate the exhibits.
The League of Explorers.howToGet: Unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.
The League of Explorers.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Hall of Explorers, in the League of Explorers adventure.

The League of Explorers.name: Shattering Spree
The League of Explorers.text: Destroy all Statues. For each destroyed, deal 1 damage.

The League of Explorers.name: Shattering Spree
The League of Explorers.text: Destroy all Statues. For each destroyed, deal 3 damage.

The League of Explorers.name: Slithering Archer
The League of Explorers.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions.

The League of Explorers.name: Unstable Portal
The League of Explorers.text: Hero Power Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: A Light in the Darkness
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Wait, how can you have a light in the dark?  If you turn on a light while it’s dark, doesn’t that mean it’s no longer dark?

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Beckoner of Evil
Whispers of the Old Gods.howToGet: Unlocked when opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.
Whispers of the Old Gods.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked after opening a Whispers of the Old Gods pack.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Bilefin Tidehunter
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Bile actually makes for surprisingly sturdy fins.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Cult Sorcerer
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: [x]Spell Damage +1 After you cast a spell, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: No matter how many times we tell her not to, she keeps feeding C'Thun scraps under the table.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Darkshire Librarian
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card. Deathrattle: Draw a card.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Do NOT be late with your overdue fines.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Duskboar
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Often excluded from dinner parties.  To be fair, he is very boaring.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Embrace the Shadow
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: This turn, your healing effects deal damage instead.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: For when your Auchenai Soulpriests call in sick.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Eternal Sentinel
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Just try to avoid eye contact.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Mark of Y'Shaarj
Whispers of the Old Gods.text:
Give a minion +2/+2.
If it's a Beast, draw
a card.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Y'Shaarj had three sons: Mark, Theodore, and Chris.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Nat, the Darkfisher
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: At the start of your opponent's turn, they have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: You can take away his humanity, but you will never take away his fishing pole.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Renounce Darkness
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Replace your Hero Power and Warlock cards with another class's. The cards cost (1) less.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Stormcrack
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: WARNING: DO NOT TOUCH THE PURPLE BALL OF LIGHTNING

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: The Tidal Hand
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Hero Power Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Murloc.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twilight Geomancer
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: "Ok C'Thun, repeat after me: 'Your mother was a hamster.'"

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Twisted Worgen
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Sometimes the Old Gods' corruptions gives you power untold, sometimes you get +1 Attack. We can’t all be winners in the Eldritch lottery.

Whispers of the Old Gods.name: Undercity Huckster
Whispers of the Old Gods.text: Deathrattle: Add a random class card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
Whispers of the Old Gods.flavor: Psst! Wanna buy a random class card (from your opponent's class)?

Karazhan.name: Archmage's Apprentice
Karazhan.text: Whenever you cast a spell, shuffle a copy of it into your deck.

Karazhan.name: Cat Trick
Karazhan.text: Secret: After your opponent casts a spell, summon a 4/2 Panther with Stealth.
Karazhan.flavor: "I know some new tricks, a lot of good tricks. I will show them to you. Medivh will not mind at all if I do."
Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

Karazhan.name: Cheat
Karazhan.text: Hero Power Destroy the left-most enemy minion.

Karazhan.name: Empowerment
Karazhan.text: Give your hero +8 Attack this turn.

Karazhan.name: Kindly Grandmother
Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

Karazhan.name: Maelstrom Portal
Karazhan.flavor: They bill this as a popular resort attraction, but they try and get your money up front.
Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.
Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Parlor, in One Night in Karazhan.

Karazhan.name: Mediva 1
Karazhan.text:
Portals cost (1) less. 
Does not count as a minion.

Karazhan.name: Mediva 2
Karazhan.text:
Portals cost (1) less. 
Does not count as a minion.

Karazhan.name: Mediva 3
Karazhan.text:
Portals cost (1) less. 
Does not count as a minion.

Karazhan.name: Medivh's Valet
Karazhan.text: Battlecry: If you control a Secret, deal 3 damage.
Karazhan.flavor: "Magus Medivh sir, I've brought the flaming balloons, as you requested."
Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

Karazhan.name: Nether Rage
Karazhan.text: Hero Power Give your hero +3 Attack this turn.

Karazhan.name: Netherspite Historian
Karazhan.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, Discover a Dragon.
Karazhan.flavor: She can tell you all about the history of people not STANDING IN THE GREEN BEAM!
Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.
Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Spire, in One Night in Karazhan.

Karazhan.name: Pompous Thespian
Karazhan.flavor: Alas poor Annoy-o-Tron! A fellow of infinite jest, of most excellent fancy!
Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.
Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Opera, in One Night in Karazhan.

Karazhan.name: Purify
Karazhan.text: Silence a friendly minion. Draw a card.
Karazhan.flavor: Even better than a hot shower with vigorous scrubbing!
Karazhan.howToGet: Unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.
Karazhan.howToGetGold: Crafting unlocked in the Menagerie, in One Night in Karazhan.

Karazhan.name: Terrifying Roar
Karazhan.text: Return an enemy minion to your opponent's hand.

Credits.name: Becca Abel
Credits.text: Whenever you draw a card, make it Golden.

Credits.name: Jerry Mascho
Credits.text: At the start of your turn, deal 1 damage. If this card is golden, deal 1 damage at the end of your turn instead. THIS IS A HAN SOLO JOKE.

Credits.name: Keith Landes
Credits.text: At the start of your turn, get -2 Health due to hunger.

Credits.name: Ryan Chew
